New Records: Liam Livingstone hit his maiden ODI hundred.
England's chase of 329 is the second-highest in ODI cricket history in the Caribbean Islands.
Key Match Events: Liam Livingstone scored 124 runs off 85 balls, including five boundaries and nine sixes.
England surpassed the West Indies' total with 15 balls to spare, winning the match by five wickets.
Pre-Game Insights: England needed to win this encounter to keep themselves alive in the series after a defeat in the rain-hit campaign opener by eight wickets on October 31.
Post-Match Reflections: Liam Livingstone expressed pride in his performance, stating his hard work over the last few months has started paying off.
Livingstone mentioned that he has been getting back to his best and enjoying his cricket.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's chase of 329 for 5 is the second-highest successful ODI chase in the West Indies.
